clinical_study.brief_title: Study of MDX-1411 in Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia or Mantle Cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Multicenter, Dose-escalation, Multidose Study of MDX-1411 Administered Every 7 Days in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia or Mantle Cell Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: To determine if MDX-1411 is safe for the treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia or mantle cell lymphoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Dose-escalation, multidose study of MDX-1411, a fully human nonfucosylated monoclonal antibody (mAb) targeting the CD70 transmembrane cell-surface protein, which is highly expressed in B-cell malignancies such as CLL and MCL.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety Profile of MDX-1411 and determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD)

clinical_study.condition: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia or Mantle Cell Lymphoma.

arm_group.description: An accelerated titration design (ATD) will be utilized and subjects will be assigned to a dose level in the order they enter the study.

intervention.description: Single dose of MDX-1411 (fully human monoclonal antibody) will be administered as an intravenous (i.v.) infusion every 7 days for up to a total of 5 doses.
